holidays.title: New Year's Day
holidays.notes: Start of the new year. High retail activity for fitness, health, and resolution-related products.

holidays.title: Human Rights Day
holidays.notes: Commemorates the Sharpeville massacre. Focus on community, equality, and social causes.

holidays.title: Good Friday
holidays.notes: Christian holiday. Many businesses closed. Travel and family gatherings.

holidays.title: Family Day
holidays.notes: Easter Monday. Long weekend, family activities, and outdoor events.

holidays.title: Freedom Day
holidays.notes: Celebrates the first democratic elections in 1994. National pride and heritage focus.

holidays.title: Workers' Day
holidays.notes: International Workers' Day. Labour rights focus. Retail promotions common.

holidays.title: Youth Day
holidays.notes: Commemorates the 1976 Soweto uprising. Youth-focused campaigns and education themes.

holidays.title: National Women's Day
holidays.notes: Celebrates the 1956 women's march. Women-focused campaigns, beauty, wellness, empowerment.

holidays.title: Heritage Day
holidays.notes: Also known as Braai Day. Celebrates SA's diverse culture. Food, family, and outdoor activities.

holidays.title: Day of Reconciliation
holidays.notes: Promotes national unity. Start of festive retail season peak.

holidays.title: Christmas Day
holidays.notes: Major retail and gifting holiday. Peak festive season.

holidays.title: Day of Goodwill
holidays.notes: Boxing Day. Major sales day. Post-Christmas promotions.
